Mr. William G. Har1ey

Washington 6, D. C.
Dear Mr. Harley:
I certainly appreciate your letter of April 24. I do
hope that I have been of some assistance in the ultimate
desires of Educational Television Appropriations for the
various states. However, from observation and reports,
1 do not believe our Congressman, Mr. Harris, is completely
sold on our endeavors. Will you please inform Mr. Hall
that I have again contacted the Governor with regards to
his telegram. I am asking that I be furnished with a
copy of his reply.
Sincerely yours.
President
TET:ng
P.S. If possible, would you please secure and forward
at least 4 or 5 copies of my testimony before
the committee.
TET
